intro: Staurogyne miqueliana, commonly known as the Miquel's water thyme, is a species of aquatic plant native to South America. It is a member of the Hydrocharitaceae family and is characterized by its dense, floating mats of narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually submerged, and it reproduces both sexually and vegetatively. Staurogyne miqueliana plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
